content.6: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
content.9: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister,
content.10: How fair is thy love, my sister,
content.14: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:
content.15: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.
content.16: Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden,
